### CheckedZextOrTrunc() {#a7da51e81430a2e11b0573c4b80d3911a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static bool CheckedZextOrTrunc (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> &amp; I, unsigned IntTyBits)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
When we&#39;re compiling N-bit code, and the user uses parameters that are greater than N bits (e.g.

uint64&#95;t on a 32-bit build), we can run into trouble with <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> size issues. This function handles resizing + overflow checks for us. <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/check">Check</a> and zext or trunc <code>I</code> depending on IntTyBits and I&#39;s value.

Definition at line <a href="#l00355">355</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/memorybuiltins-cpp">MemoryBuiltins.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

<Link id="l00173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="173"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="174"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Returns the allocation data for the given value if it&#39;s a call to a known</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="175"><Highlight kind="comment">/// allocation function.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="176"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> std::optional&lt;AllocFnsTy&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="177" lineLink="#a3c3ae5109d96640fa77e6942513269d6"><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="#a3c3ae5109d96640fa77e6942513269d6">getAllocationDataForFunction</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &#42;Callee, <a href="#abb725d65acc814edc5c025fb8ee6d55b">AllocType</a> AllocTy,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="178"><Highlight kind="normal">                             </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetlibraryinfo">TargetLibraryInfo</a> &#42;TLI) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="179"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Don&#39;t perform a slow TLI lookup, if this function doesn&#39;t return a pointer</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="180"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// and thus can&#39;t be an allocation function.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="181"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!Callee-&gt;getReturnType()-&gt;isPointerTy())</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="182"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> std::nullopt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="183"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00284" /><CodeLine lineNumber="284"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Tests if a value is a call or invoke to a library function that</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00285" /><CodeLine lineNumber="285"><Highlight kind="comment">/// allocates or reallocates memory (either malloc, calloc, realloc, or strdup</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00350" /><CodeLine lineNumber="350"><Highlight kind="comment">/// When we&#39;re compiling N-bit code, and the user uses parameters that are</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00351" /><CodeLine lineNumber="351"><Highlight kind="comment">/// greater than N bits (e.g. uint64&#95;t on a 32-bit build), we can run into</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00352" /><CodeLine lineNumber="352"><Highlight kind="comment">/// trouble with APInt size issues. This function handles resizing + overflow</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00353" /><CodeLine lineNumber="353"><Highlight kind="comment">/// checks for us. Check and zext or trunc \\p I depending on IntTyBits and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00354" /><CodeLine lineNumber="354"><Highlight kind="comment">/// I&#39;s value.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00355" /><CodeLine lineNumber="355" lineLink="#a7da51e81430a2e11b0573c4b80d3911a"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="#a7da51e81430a2e11b0573c4b80d3911a">CheckedZextOrTrunc</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> IntTyBits) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00356" /><CodeLine lineNumber="356"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// More bits than we can handle. Checking the bit width isn&#39;t necessary, but</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00357" /><CodeLine lineNumber="357"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// it&#39;s faster than checking active bits, and should give &#96;false&#96; in the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00358" /><CodeLine lineNumber="358"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// vast majority of cases.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00359" /><CodeLine lineNumber="359"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>.getBitWidth() &gt; IntTyBits &amp;&amp; <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>.getActiveBits() &gt; IntTyBits)</Highlight></CodeLine>
